Today we had a really good ski training session. We set out to practice our camp-setting and camp-striking routines. We skied out of Resolute, set camp, and went to bed. After a 15 minute â€œgood nightâ€™s sleepâ€ we pretended it was morning, got up, and struck camp. This was yet another rude awakening: crawling out of a warm sleeping bag to face these freezing, windy conditions is no joke. But the practice session was useful: we found many little things that needed fine tuning or repair.

The efficiency and realism of our training session was sharpened by a brisk 30-knot wind.

To our surprise, we found that our half-loaded pulkhas were sensitive to crosswinds: they would slew off to one side, even on shallow inclines.

All is well with the Expedition.
